00046 /*
00047  * Concatenates the format string to the out buffer.
00048  * 
00049  * @param out The out buffer. The format string will be concatenated to this
00050  *              parameter.
00051  * @param buffer_len Maximum length allowed to write at out buffer.
00052  * @param format The format string.
00053  * @param ... The arguments to the format string.
00054  */

00056 
00057 /*
00058  * Cancatenates an hex dump to the out buffer.
00059  * 
00060  * @param out The out buffer. The format string will be concatenated to this
00061  *              parameter.
00062  * @param buffer_len Maximum length allowed to write at out buffer.
00063  * @param data The data to be dumped.
00064  * @param len How many bytes will be dumped from data.
00065  */
00066 static void console_dump(char *out, int buffer_len, u_char *data, int len);

00133 /*
00134  * console interface struct.
00135  */
00136 static layer_console_t layer_console = {
00137         lnp_console_execute_command,
00138         lnp_console_get_command_list
00139 };
00140 
00141 /*
00142  * Command identifiers.
00143  */
00144 #define COMMAND_ID                              1
00145 #define COMMAND_WRITE                   2
00146 #define COMMAND_READ                    3
00147 #define COMMAND_FLUSH                   4
00148 #define COMMAND_CONNECTIONS             5
00149 #define COMMAND_HISTORY                 6
00150 #define COMMAND_CONNECT                 7
00151 #define COMMAND_KEYS                    8
00152 
00153 /*
00154  * All available commands to link stub module.
00155  */
00156 static command_t commands[] = {
00157         {COMMAND_ID, "id", "[id]"
00158                         ". output your id in base 16."},
00159         {COMMAND_WRITE, "write", "[write <id> <msg>]"
00160                         ". send a message to <id> using LNP_PROTOCOL_UNRELIABLE."},
00161         {COMMAND_READ, "read", "[read]"
00162                         ". read the next packet received from LNP_PROTOCOL_UNRELIABLE."},
00163         {COMMAND_FLUSH, "flush", "[flush]"
00164                         ". dispose all enqueued messages."},
00165         {COMMAND_CONNECTIONS, "connections", "[connections]"
00166                         ". output connections status."},
00167         {COMMAND_HISTORY, "history", "[history <id>]"
00168                         ". output the history for some ID."},
00169         {COMMAND_CONNECT, "connect", "[connect <id>]"
00170                         ". connect to some ID."},
00171         {COMMAND_KEYS, "keys", "[keys <id>]"
00172                         ". show keys negaciated with some ID."},
00173 };
00174 
00175 /*============================================================================*/
00176 /* Public functions implementations.                                          */
00177 /*============================================================================*/
00178 
00179 layer_console_t *get_console_interface() {
00180         return &layer_console;
00181 }
00182 /******************************************************************************/
00183 static void lnp_console_execute_command(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, 
00184                 int function_id, char *args) {
00185         switch (function_id) {
00186                 case COMMAND_ID:
00187                         console_id(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00188                         break;
00189                 case COMMAND_WRITE:
00190                         console_write(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00191                         break;
00192                 case COMMAND_READ:
00193                         console_read(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00194                         break;
00195                 case COMMAND_FLUSH:
00196                         console_flush(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00197                         break;
00198                 case COMMAND_CONNECTIONS:
00199                         console_connections(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00200                         break;
00201                 case COMMAND_HISTORY:
00202                         console_history(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00203                         break;
00204                 case COMMAND_CONNECT:
00205                         console_connect(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00206                         break;
00207                 case COMMAND_KEYS:
00208                         console_print_keys(out_buffer, buffer_len, args);
00209                         break;
00210         }
00211 }
00212 /******************************************************************************/
00213 static void lnp_console_get_command_list(command_t **command_arg, int *size) {
00214         *command_arg = commands;
00215         *size = sizeof(commands);       
00216 }
00217

00219 /* Private functions implementations.                                         */

00221 
00222 void console_id(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00223         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "ID: ");
00224         console_print_id(out_buffer, buffer_len, my_id);
00225         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "\n");
00226 }
00227 /******************************************************************************/
00228 void console_print_keys(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00229         char *tok;
00230         net_id_t id;
00231         int store_index;
00232         
00233         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00234         if (tok == NULL) {
00235                 return;
00236         }
00237 
00238         parse_id(id, tok);
00239 
00240         int routing_entry = lnp_routing_entry_lock(id);
00241         if (routing_entry == NULL_SLOT) {
00242                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "no routing entry.\n");
00243                 return;
00244         }
00245         store_index = routing_table[routing_entry].store_index;
00246         if (store_index == NULL_SLOT) {
00247                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "no keys.\n");
00248                 return;
00249         }
00250         lnp_key_entry_t *entry = &lnp_key_store[store_index];
00251         if (entry->handshake_state == LNP_HANDSHAKE_CONNECTED) {
00252                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   cipher_in_key:");
00253                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00254                                 entry->cipher_in_key,
00255                                 entry->cipher->key_length);
00256 
00257                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   cipher_out_key:");
00258                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00259                                 entry->cipher_out_key,
00260                                 entry->cipher->key_length);
00261 
00262                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   cipher_in_iv:");
00263                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00264                                 entry->cipher_in_iv,
00265                                 entry->cipher->iv_length);
00266 
00267                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   cipher_out_iv:");
00268                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00269                                 entry->cipher_out_iv,
00270                                 entry->cipher->iv_length);
00271 
00272                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   mac_in_key:");
00273                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00274                                 entry->mac_in_key, 
00275                                 entry->mac->key_length);
00276 
00277                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "   mac_out_key:");
00278                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00279                                 entry->mac_out_key, 
00280                                 entry->mac->key_length);
00281         } else {
00282                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "session not established yet\n");
00283         }
00284         
00285         lnp_routing_entry_unlock(routing_entry);
00286 }
00287 /******************************************************************************/
00288 void console_connect(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00289         char *tok;
00290         net_id_t id;
00291 
00292         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00293         if (tok == NULL) {
00294                 return;
00295         }
00296 
00297         parse_id(id, tok);
00298         
00299         if (lnp_connect(id) == NET_OK) {
00300                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Connected.\n");
00301         } else {
00302                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Error connecting.\n");
00303         }
00304 }
00305 /******************************************************************************/
00306 void console_write(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00307         char *tok;
00308         u_char *msg;
00309         net_id_t id;
00310 
00311         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00312         if (tok == NULL) {
00313                 return;
00314         }
00315 
00316         parse_id(id, tok);
00317 
00318         tok = strtok(NULL, " \n");
00319         if (tok == NULL) {
00320                 return;
00321         }
00322         msg = (u_char*)tok;
00323         
00324         lnp_write(id, msg, strlen(tok)+1, LNP_PROTOCOL_UNRELIABLE);
00325         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Message sent.\n");
00326 }
00327 /******************************************************************************/
00328 void console_read(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00329         net_id_t id;
00330         int return_value;
00331         u_char buffer[1000]; // TODO, colocar constante FTU
00332 
00333         return_value = lnp_read(id, buffer, sizeof(buffer), LNP_PROTOCOL_UNRELIABLE);
00334         if (return_value == NET_ERROR) {
00335                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "Error reading.\n");
00336         } else {
00337                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00338                                 "Message read from id: ");
00339 
00340                 console_print_id(out_buffer, buffer_len, id);
00341                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "\nMSG(%d): ", return_value);
00342                 console_dump(out_buffer, buffer_len, buffer, return_value);
00343                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "\n");
00344         }
00345 }
00346 /******************************************************************************/
00347 void console_connections(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00348         int i;
00349 
00350         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "%-40s %-15s\n", 
00351                         "ID",
00352                         "State");
00353 
00354         for (i = 0; i < ROUTING_TABLE_SIZE; i++) {
00355                 routing_entry_t *routing_entry = &routing_table[i];
00356                 u_int store_index = routing_entry->store_index;
00357                 if (store_index == NULL_SLOT) {
00358                         continue;
00359                 }
00360                 lnp_key_entry_t *entry = &lnp_key_store[store_index];
00361 
00362                 console_print_id(out_buffer, buffer_len, routing_table[i].id);
00363 
00364                 /*console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "  %-10d %-10d", 
00365                                 entry->packets_sent,
00366                                 entry->packets_received);*/
00367                                 
00368                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, " %-15s\n", 
00369                                 entry->handshake_state==LNP_HANDSHAKE_CLOSED?
00370                                         "CLOSED":
00371                                 entry->handshake_state==LNP_HANDSHAKE_CONNECTING?
00372                                         "CONNECTING":
00373                                 entry->handshake_state==LNP_HANDSHAKE_BEING_CONNECTED?
00374                                         "BEING CONNECTED":
00375                                 entry->handshake_state==LNP_HANDSHAKE_EXCHANGING_KEYS?
00376                                         "EXCHANGING KEYS":
00377                                 "CONNECTED");
00378         }
00379 }
00380 /******************************************************************************/
00381 void console_flush(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00382         int return_value;
00383         
00384         return_value = lnp_flush(LNP_PROTOCOL_UNRELIABLE);
00385         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, 
00386                         "Messages flushed: %d.\n", return_value);
00387 }
00388 /******************************************************************************/
00389 void console_history(char *out_buffer, int buffer_len, char *args) {
00390         char *tok;
00391         net_id_t id;
00392         int j;
00393 
00394         tok = strtok(args, " \n");
00395         if (tok == NULL) {
00396                 return;
00397         }
00398 
00399         parse_id(id, tok);
00400 
00401         int routing_entry = lnp_routing_entry_lock(id);
00402         if (routing_entry == NULL_SLOT) {
00403                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "no routing entry.\n");
00404                 return;
00405         }
00406         history_entry_t *entry = &routing_table[routing_entry].history;
00407         if (entry->begin == entry->end) {
00408                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "[*EMPTY*]\n");          
00409         } else {
00410                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "sessions: ");
00411                 for (j=entry->begin; j!=entry->end; j=(j+1)%HISTORY_SIZE) {
00412                         console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "[%2d]", entry->history[j]);             
00413                 }
00414                 console_printf(out_buffer, buffer_len, "[*END*]\n");
00415         }
00416         
00417         lnp_routing_entry_unlock(routing_entry);
00418 }
00419 /******************************************************************************/
00420 void console_printf(char *out, int buffer_len, const char * format, ...) {
00421 
00422         char line[100];
00423     va_list ap;
00424 
00425     va_start(ap, format);
00426         vsnprintf(line, sizeof(line), format, ap);
00427     va_end(ap);
00428     
00429     strncat(out, line, buffer_len - strlen(out) - 1);
00430 }
00431 /******************************************************************************/
00432 void console_dump(char *out, int buffer_len, u_char *data, int len) {
00433         int k;  
00434         for(k=0; k<len; k++) {
00435                 if (k%16==0) console_printf(out, buffer_len, "\n");
00436                 console_printf(out, buffer_len, " %02X", data[k]);
00437         }
00438         console_printf(out, buffer_len, "\n");
00439 }
00440 /******************************************************************************/
00441 void console_print_id(char *out, int buffer_len, net_id_t id) {
00442         int i;
00443         for (i=0; i<sizeof(net_id_t); i++) {
00444                 console_printf(out, buffer_len, "%02X", id[i]);
00445         }
00446 }
00447 /******************************************************************************/
00448 void parse_id(net_id_t id, char *tok) {
00449         int i;
00450         for (i=0; tok[i] && i<NET_ID_LENGTH*2; i+=2) {
00451                 int aux_1 = tok[i]>='A' ? (tok[i]-'A'+10) : (tok[i]-'0');
00452                 int aux_2 = tok[i+1]>='A' ? (tok[i+1]-'A'+10) : (tok[i+1]-'0');
00453                 id[i/2] = aux_1*16 + aux_2;
00454         }
00455 }
